column5: Plans for a couple of us to hit the hard water was planned for today,but things happen,so it was a solo trip.Get to the lake and no ones there,guess when you arrive at 5:30am,it,sd to be expected.  Getting back into my keaner ways.LOL  Short drag out with the hut,set up and wait for the bite. It started to get busy around 7ish.  Sleepers I guess.LOL  Any ways,managed only one wee tiny eye (which was released to grow) for my 6 hour outing.  I poped abunch of hole to make up for not getting the use out of my gas auger last season.Sure glad I brought it as the ice was pretty much 11-12 inches.  Didnt matter though,the weather was perfect and even got a bit of a sun burn on the face.  I do though,need to look into getting a machine. The knees cant take the dragging like they use to.Yayaya I know,getting old.LOL  The forcast for sunday looks like a trip to the river.    <embed width="600" height="361" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowFullscreen="true" allowNetworking="all" wmode="transparent" src="http://static.photobucket.com/player.swf" flashvars="file=http%3A%2F%2Fvid1234.photobucket.com%2Falbums%2Fff417%2Fbrianb64%2Ficefishing2012002-4.mp4">
good to see you still got out B and were not skunked.
Sometimes solo mission is the way to go Brian But your hauling too much hardware for my likings    I always travel light Looks like you had fun Nice eye btw
Hey, you got out and avoided mr "white stripe", anyways, Brian.
Fishing, one of the things that can be just as much fun alone as it is with friends. Sounds like you got some good exercise ... Never a bad thing. Thx for sharing!
No skunk, and sunburn in January..hummmmmmm, let me think.........Yup Sounds like a great day to me Brian Thanks for the report
You gona eat that one Brian ?
:wallbash:  Any ways,managed only one wee tiny eye (which was released to grow)
Nice one Brian.......like they said...no skunkypoo and a nice tan too....awesome!
Atleast you got out. Im still waiting to try out my new auger and x67.
